alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Eastern Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 6:26PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern New Castle, southeastern Chester and southwestern Delaware Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 625 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Stanton, or near Newark, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Newark, Westtown, Elsmere, Kennett Square, New Castle, Newport, Greenville, Stanton, Cheyney, North Star, Talleyville, Landenberg, Wilmington Manor, Elam, Pike Creek, Concordville, Hockessin, Ashland and Avondale. This includes Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 1 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Mount Holly NJ. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northern Delaware...southern New Jersey...and southeastern Pennsylvania.
